q_text: Identify the error in the following code #include <iostream> using namespace std; void fun() { } static int  x=5 x++;  cout << x << " ";  int main() {  for (int   i=0  i<3 i++)  fun();  }  return 0;
#include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() {  }  unsigned int  x=0  x=x-1;  cout << x <<< endl;  return 0;
options: Logic Error - Unexpected large value due to underflow
Compilation Error - Cannot subtract from unsigned integer

q_text: What will be the output of the following code? #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() {  }  char ch ='A';  int num =ch+1  cout << num;  return 0;
#include <iostream> #include <climits> using namespace std; int main() {  }  int a= INT_MIN; int b=-1  cout << ( a/b)  return 0;
#include <iostream> #include <fstream> using namespace std; int main() {  }  ifstream fp;  char buffer[50];  fp >> buffer; // Similar to fscanf  cout << buffer;  fp.close();  return 0;
#include <iostream> using namespace std; void recursive Function() {  }  int  x=5  recursive Function();  int main() {  }  recursive Function();  return 0;
#include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int arr[5] ={1,2,3,4,5}; for (int i=0; i<=5;i++) { cout << arr[i]<<";" } } return 0;
#include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() {  }  float x=0.1f;  if ( x==0.1f)  cout << "Equal";  else  cout << "Not Equal";  return 0;
#include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() {  }  int x=5  cout << x << " " << x++ << " " << ++x;  return 0;
#include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { if (1)  else  cout << "Else block executed\n";  cout << "Code continues...\n";  return 0; }
